intro: Gelidocalamus dongdingensis, commonly known as the Dongding bamboo, is a rare and cold-tolerant species native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, hollow stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. This plant thrives in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates and well-drained soil. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
